io.branch.referral

Class SystemObserver

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.branch.referral.SystemObserver

  • public class SystemObserver
extends java.lang.Object

    Class that provides a series of methods providing access to commonly used, device-wide attributes and parameters used by the Branch class, and made publically available for use by other classes.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      Default value for when no value has been returned by a system information call, but where null is not supported or desired.

    • Method Detail

      • getUniqueID

        public java.lang.String getUniqueID(boolean debug)

        Gets the String value of the Secure#ANDROID_ID setting in the device. This immutable value is generated upon initial device setup, and re-used throughout the life of the device.

        If true is provided as a parameter, the method will return a different, randomly-generated value each time that it is called. This allows you to simulate many different user devices with different ANDROID_ID values with a single physical device or emulator.

        Parameters:
        debug - A Boolean value indicating whether to run in real or debug mode.
        Returns:

        A String value representing the unique ANDROID_ID of the device, or a randomly-generated debug value in place of a real identifier.

      • hasRealHardwareId

        public boolean hasRealHardwareId()

        Checks the value of the isRealHardWareId Boolean value within the current instance of the class. If not set by the hasRealHardwareId() or will default to true upon class instantiation.

        Returns:

        A Boolean value indicating whether or not the current device has a hardware identifier; Secure#ANDROID_ID

      • getURIScheme

        public java.lang.String getURIScheme()

        Provides the package name of the current app, and passes it to the getURIScheme(String) method to enable the call without a String parameter.

        This method should be used for retrieving the URI scheme of the current application.

        Returns:
        A String value containing the response from getURIScheme(String).

      • getURIScheme

        public java.lang.String getURIScheme(java.lang.String packageName)

        Gets the URI scheme of the specified package from its AndroidManifest.xml file.

        This method should be used for retrieving the URI scheme of the another application of which the package name is known.

        Parameters:
        packageName - A String containing the full package name of the app to check.
        Returns:

        A String containing the output of ApkParser#decompressXML(String).

      • getListOfApps

        public JSONArray getListOfApps()

        Gets a JSONArray object containing a list of the applications that are installed on the current device.

        The method gets a handle on the PackageManager and calls the PackageManager#getInstalledApplications(int) method to retrieve a List of ApplicationInfo objects, each representing a single application that is installed on the current device.

        For each of these items, the method gets the attributes shown below, and constructs a JSONArray representation of the list, which can be consumed by a JSON parser on the server.

        • loadLabel
        • packageName
        • publicSourceDir
        • sourceDir
        • publicSourceDir
        • uriScheme
        Returns:

        A JSONArray containing information about all of the applications installed on the current device.

      • getAppVersion

        public java.lang.String getAppVersion()

        Gets the package name of the current application that the SDK is integrated with.

        Returns:

        A String value containing the full package name of the application that the SDK is currently integrated into.

      • getCarrier

        public java.lang.String getCarrier()

        Gets the name of the network operator that the current telephony-capable device is connected to.

        Returns:

        A String value containing the network-provided name of the telephony carrier that the current device is connected to.

      • getBluetoothPresent

        public boolean getBluetoothPresent()

        Checks whether the current device has Bluetooth capability of any kind by attempting to instantiate a BluetoothAdapter object that points to the default Bluetooth adapter of the device. If Bluetooth is not supported, the assignment will be null and false will be returned as a result.

        Returns:

        A Boolean value indicating whether or not Bluetooth is supported and enabled on the current device.

        • true - the device supports Bluetooth, and the adapter is enabled.
        • false - the device does not support Bluetooth, or the adapter is disabled.

      • getBluetoothVersion

        public java.lang.String getBluetoothVersion()

        Checks whether the current device supports Bluetooth Low Energy (LE).

        This is determined by checking the SDK version available on the current device. BTLE was introduced in Android 4.3 (API Level 18), so if the current device reports that it supports the highest platform version that is 17 or lower, the device does not support the required platform hooks to communicate with capable devices via the Bluetooth Low-Energy profile.

        Returns:

        A Boolean value indicating whether or not Bluetooth LE is available on the current device.

        • true - this device supports Bluetooth LE.
        • false - this device does not support Bluetooth LE.

      • getNFCPresent

        public boolean getNFCPresent()

        Checks whether or not the current device has near-field communication capabilities.

        Returns:

        A Boolean value indicating whether or not NFC capabilities exist in the current device.

        • true - Current device has NFC capabilities.
        • false - Current device has no NFC capabilities.

      • getTelephonePresent

        public boolean getTelephonePresent()

        Checks whether or not the current device has telephone capabilities; i.e. whether or not it is able to connect to a mobile or cellphone network and send or recieve SMS messages, and or make calls.

        Returns:

        A Boolean value indicating whether telephony capabilities exist on the current device.

        • true - the device has telephony capabilities; is a phone or phablet.
        • false - the device has telephony capabilities; is a WiFi tablet or other non-phone device.

      • getPhoneBrand

        public java.lang.String getPhoneBrand()

        Returns the hardware manufacturer of the current device, as defined by the manufacturer.

        Returns:
        A String value containing the hardware manufacturer of the current device.
        See Also:
        Build.MANUFACTURER

      • getPhoneModel

        public java.lang.String getPhoneModel()

        Returns the hardware model of the current device, as defined by the manufacturer.

        Returns:
        A String value containing the hardware model of the current device.
        See Also:
        Build.MODEL

      • getOS

        public java.lang.String getOS()

        Hard-coded value, used by the Branch object to differentiate between iOS, Web and Android SDK versions.

        Not of practical use in your application.

        Returns:
        A String value that indicates the broad OS type that is in use on the device.

      • getOSVersion

        public int getOSVersion()
        Returns the Android API version of the current device as an Integer. Common values:
        • 22 - Android 5.1, Lollipop MR1
        • 21 - Android 5.0, Lollipop
        • 19 - Android 4.4, Kitkat
        • 18 - Android 4.3, Jellybean
        • 15 - Android 4.0.4, Ice Cream Sandwich MR1
        • 13 - Android 3.2, Honeycomb MR2
        • 10 - Android 2.3.4, Gingerbread MR1
        Returns:
        An Integer value representing the SDK/Platform Version of the OS of the current device.
        See Also:
        Android Developers - API Level and Platform Version

      • isSimulator

        public boolean isSimulator()

        As the Build fingerprint is determined by the OS fingerprint, this will identify whether a an emulator is being used where the developer of said emulator has followed convention and used generic as the first segment of the virtual device fingerprint.

        Example of a real device (Google Nexus 5, Android 5.1):

         google/hammerhead/hammerhead:5.1/LMY47D/1743759:user/release-keys

        Example of an emulator (Genymotion Nexus 6 AVD, Android 5.0):

         generic/vbox86p/vbox86p:5.0/LRX21M/buildbot12160004:userdebug/test-keys

        Returns:

        A Boolean value indicating whether the device upon which the app is being run is a simulated platform, i.e. an emulator. Or a real, hardware device.

        • true - the app is running on an emulator
        • false - the app is running on a physical device (or a badly configured AVD)

      • getUpdateState

        public int getUpdateState(boolean updatePrefs)

        This method returns an Integer value dependent on whether the application has been updated since its installation on the device. If the application has just been installed and launched immediately, this will always return 1.

        If however the application has already been installed for more than the duration of a single update cycle, and has received one or more updates, the time in PackageInfo#firstInstallTime will be different from that in PackageInfo#lastUpdateTime so the return value will be 0; indicative of an update having occurred whilst the app has been installed.

        This is useful to know when the manner of handling of deep-link data has changed betwen application versions and where migration of SharedPrefs may be required. This method provides a condition upon which a consistency check or migration validation operation can be carried out.

        This will not work on Android SDK versions < 9, as the PackageInfo#firstInstallTime and PackageInfo#lastUpdateTime values did not exist in older versions of the PackageInfo class.

        Parameters:
        updatePrefs - A Boolean value indicating whether or not current App version number should be updated in preferences.
        Returns:

        A Integer value indicating the update state of the application package.

        • 1 - App not updated since install.
        • 0 - App has been updated since initial install.

      • getScreenDisplay

        public DisplayMetrics getScreenDisplay()

        This method returns a DisplayMetrics object that contains the attributes of the default display of the device that the SDK is running on. Use this when you need to know the dimensions of the screen, density of pixels on the display or any other information that relates to the device screen.

        Especially useful when operating without an Activity context, e.g. from a background service.

        Returns:

        A DisplayMetrics object representing the default display of the device.

        See Also:
        DisplayMetrics

      • getWifiConnected

        public boolean getWifiConnected()

        Use this method to query the system state to determine whether a WiFi connection is available for use by applications installed on the device.

        This applies only to WiFi connections, and does not indicate whether there is a viable Internet connection available; if connected to an offline WiFi router for instance, the boolean will still return true.

        Returns:

        A boolean value that indicates whether a WiFi connection exists and is open.

        • true - A WiFi connection exists and is open.
        • false - Not connected to WiFi.

      • getAdvertisingId

        public java.lang.String getAdvertisingId()

        Google now requires that all apps use a standardised Advertising ID for all ad-based actions within Android apps.

        The Google Play services APIs expose the advertising tracking ID as UUID such as this:

        38400000-8cf0-11bd-b23e-10b96e40000d
        Returns:

        A String value containing the client ad UUID as supplied by Google Play.

        See Also:
        Android Developers - Advertising ID
